instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Hello,
So this macbook came with one port rebooting the amp meter.
One port stuck at 5V and other were normal at 20V.

Checked the board.
Corrosion at <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and the corresponding charging port.

Replaced the charging port so now all 4 ports drawing 20V.

How to confirm whether <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> need to be replaced?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
The machine works now?

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP> may be good, if its port switches to 20V, without battery connected.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: No the machine doesnt turn on. I get the mouse click for sometime when connected to power

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Does it charge the battery?
Which voltages do you get on the MLB?
Any reaction pressing power button?

Use 61/87W charger for tests.
Try SMC bypass, just in case.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
So without a battery it turns on. But when i connect the battery its not doing anything. Not charging the battery.

I am uing 96W charger.

Should i just leave it on charge for a few hours and see if the battery picks up charge or do we need to replace the battery.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
You should test with known good battery.
Or check the battery with a dedicated tool, like NLBA1.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Tried a known good battery. Works now. Thanks

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Any history available?

Check ohm resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23.
What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with both charger and battery connected?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:

<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> is .503
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> is.405

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
I meant resistance between capacitor pins, not to ground.
You should get 2 ohm aprox.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: i am getting .013 in diode mode between pin 1 and pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR>/0

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
I said to check resistance (ohm scale).
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> + <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> + <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> -> 2 ohm aprox over <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR>.
Same applies for <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>.

Check mentioned resistors for correct values (1 ohm).

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> is 2.5 ohms.

<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/2 is 1.3 Ohms

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Check battery SCL/SDA lines voltage; w/ and w/o battery.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
We have a problem now. I put the board back on and plugged in the charger to check the voltages and suddenly the machine wont turn on now and only the right fan will spin at max continuously and then will stop.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 13V

After a few tries it turned on without the battery. But still only 1 fan is spinning at max.
But its turning on like before only off the charger.

INSTALLED ANOTHER WORKING BOARD ON THE CHASIS. BOTH FAN SPIN AND THE BATTERY WORKS TOO. PROBLEM FROM THE CUSTOMER'S BOARD ONLY.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Post the expected readings...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> is 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 3.4V ( I found it pulsing sometimes between 0.4 to 3.4V but then it was stable)

With Battery and With Battery + Charger

its 3.3V stable

What about diode mode to ground.
You should get very close readings between both lines.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> is 0.450
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> is 0.475

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
The difference looks to big for me.
Check if pull-up resistors from these lines are good.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Hi,
Please ignore the above readings.
I am getting .449 and .451

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Still one fan doesn't spin?
Turn on the machine with charger alone (if still possible) and install HWSensors.
Then look for any strange value reported.

Alse check what errors pop up starting in diagnostic mode.

threads.message:
In the diagnostics mode when the supposed fan test was being conducted, the second fan started spinning and then stopped.
Battery Error Code PPT001
FAN Error PPF004
Additional Reference Code PPF003

I notice that X and E are not working. I dont know if the issue was there before.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Battery error is expected, as te machine was started without battery.

Fan error may be caused by a problem on the corresponding board area.
Compare diode mode readings between both fan circuitries.
PPF003 is also fan related.

What means "X and E"?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: X and E dont work on the keyboard i mean to say. What components should i check on the FAN?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Two bad keys may be caused only by KB itself.

Take readings around <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>/50...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Is <RESISTOR>R6051</RESISTOR> a empty point on the board or there was a resistor there and it fell off. I put it back assuming that it fell off.

<RESISTOR>R6050</RESISTOR>/55/51 Values are same as <RESISTOR>R6000</RESISTOR>/05/01.

Still the same issue only 1 fan spins and it doesnt boot on battery.

If we boot the device with battery connected and display disconnected , the device recognises the battery and charges it as well. (Checked with a external display but still only 1 fan spins at max)

We had checked another board on this chasis and everything had worked well then. So i dont think its a Display Issue.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Suddenly the second fan starts to spin normally as well but the other one is still at max .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Both fan circuits are identical.
If <RESISTOR>R6001</RESISTOR> is soldered, same applies for <RESISTOR>R6051</RESISTOR>.

If only one fan spins to max, there must be a problem with its control circuit.
Failing temperature sensor should set both fans to max.

So machine turns on with battery connected, only if internal LCD assembly is disconnected at same time?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Yes, Machine turns on battery only if internal lcd is disconnected .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: If battery and charger connected, turns on but no internal image, or you don't get voltage an any big coil?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
If display + battery connected 
Device wont turn on

If Display connected and battery disconnected 
Device Turns On

If Battery connected but display disconnected 
Device Turns on

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
"If display + battery connected 
Device wont turn on"
No fans spin, no voltage on big coils???

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
One Fan goes high and then stops. No voltage on any big coil on this side of the board.

With LCD disconnected
There is voltage on all big coils except
L3500
L8410
L4310/20/30 (Maybe because no LCD connected.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
If the fan spins, that means the board turns on.
Not booting, is what we need to find why.

Try turning on the machine with all things connected, but in SMC bypass and also safe mode.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Did both,
Same thing. The single fan goes high and then off.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Install HWSensors and check reported values when booting on internal screen, with battery disconnected.
Do the same booting with battery connected and internal LCD disconnected; use external monitor.
Take screenshot in both cases, for comparison.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
Connected an external monitor.

Device stuck at apple logo without LCD connected but runs on battery so i cannot get sensor readings.

Sensor readings with the LCD connected and battery disconnected - posted earlier

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message: Tried a safe mode boot. Still stuck in apple logo

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Amp Meter Reboot
threads.message:
I was expecting I/V sensors, not temperatures.

Just in case, try known good BIOS.
